div.l: And on a daye it happed in a stounde
Syke lay þe maunciple on a maladye
Men̄ wenden̄ wysly þat he schuld dye
For whiche þis myller͗e stale both mele and corne
An hundreth tyme mor͗e þan beforne
For þ̉er be forne he stale but curtaslye
But nowe he was a thefe outreachously
For whiche þe wardeyn̄ chydde and made far͗e
But þ̉er of sette þe myller͗e noȝt a tar͗e
He crakked boste and swor͗e it was not so
Than wer þer ȝonge scolers twoo
That dwelten̄ in þe halle of þe whiche I seye
Testyff þei wer͗e and lustaff for to pleye
And only for hir͗e myrthe and reuerye
Vp on þe wardeyn̄ besily þei crye
To ȝif hem leve but a litill stounde
To go to þe mylle and sene her͗e corne y grounde
And hardily þei dorste leye her͗e nekke
The myller͗e schuld not stele hem half a pekke
Of corne ne by force ne by sleyȝht hem reve
And at þe laste þe wardeyn̄ ȝaff hem leve
Iohn hyȝht þe tone and aleyn̄ hiȝht þe toþer
Of one towne wer þei borne þat hiȝht Stroþer
Fer͗e in þe north I can not tell wher͗e
This aleyn̄ maketh redy all his geere
And on an horse þe sakke he caste onon̄
Forth goth aleyn̄ þe clerk and also Iohn
With goode swerde and with bokeler͗e be his side
Iohn knewe þe weye hym neded no gyde
And at þe Milne þe sakke a down̄ he leyth
Aleyn̄ spake firste al heyll Symon̄ in feyth
Howe fares þi fair͗e doghter and þi wyffe
Aleyn̄ welcome qduod symkyn̄ be my lyffe
And Iohn also · howe nowe what do ȝe her͗e
By god symond qduod Iohn nede hath no peer͗e
Hym behoues serue hym selfe þat has no swayn̄
Or ells he is a foole as clerkes seyne
Our͗e maunciple I hope he will be dede
So werkes hym ay þe wanges in his hede
And þer for am I comen̄ and eke Aleyn̄
To grynde our͗e corne ande karie it home a gayn̄
I pray ȝow spede us hennes all þat ȝe may
¶ It schall be done qduod symkyn̄ be my fay
What will ȝe done whil þat it is in hande
By god riȝht by þe hoper will I stande
Qduod Iohn and see how gates þe corne gase in
Þat sawe I neủer be my fader kynne
Howe þat þe hoper wagges till and froo
